content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return lowercase(replace(strip(col), r"\s|-")) * "_"
end
```

This function takes a column name `col` as input. It first strips leading and trailing whitespaces using the `strip` function. Then it lowers the case of the string with `lowercase`. To replace any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, the `replace` function is used with a regular expression pattern to match spaces and hyphens (`r"\s|-"`). Finally, an additional underscore is appended at the end for consistency in the output format.
